description.para: Calls the Amazon Chime SDK Media Pipelines TagResource API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2022 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: The ARN of the media pipeline that you want to tag. Consists of he pipeline's endpoint region, resource ID, and pipeline ID.
The ARN of the media pipeline associated with any tags. The ARN consists of the pipeline's endpoint region, resource ID, and pipeline ID.
The tags associated with the specified media pipeline.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.ChimeSDKMediaPipelines.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceARN parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceARN' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceARN parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceARN' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
The ARN of the media pipeline associated with any tags. The ARN consists of the pipeline's endpoint region, resource ID, and pipeline ID.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.ChimeSDKMediaPipelines.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
The tags associated with the specified media pipeline.

This cmdlet does not generate any output.The service response (type Amazon.ChimeSDKMediaPipelines.Model.TagResourceResponse) can be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.

description.para: The attendee IDs of the streams selected for a media pipeline.
The unique identifier for the client request. The token makes the API request idempotent. Use a unique token for each media pipeline request.
Defines the layout of the video tiles when content sharing is enabled.
The external user IDs of the streams selected for a media pipeline.
The layout setting, such as GridView in the configuration object.
The MUX type of the audio artifact configuration object.
The MUX type of the artifact configuration.
The MUX type of the video artifact configuration object.
Defines the position of the presenter video tile. Default: TopRight.
The video resolution setting in the configuration object. Default: HD at 1280 x 720. FHD resolution: 1920 x 1080.
The ARN of the sink type.
Destination type to which the media artifacts are saved. You must use an S3 bucket.
ARN of the source from which the media artifacts are captured.
Source type from which the media artifacts are captured. A Chime SDK Meeting is the only supported source.
Indicates whether the content artifact is enabled or disabled.
Indicates whether the video artifact is enabled or disabled.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'MediaCapturePipeline'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.ChimeSDKMediaPipelines.Model.CreateMediaCapturePipelineResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.ChimeSDKMediaPipelines.Model.CreateMediaCapturePipelineResponse will result in that property being returned. This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The MUX type of the audio artifact configuration object.
The unique identifier for the client request. The token makes the API request idempotent. Use a unique token for each media pipeline request.
The layout setting, such as GridView in the configuration object.
The video resolution setting in the configuration object. Default: HD at 1280 x 720. FHD resolution: 1920 x 1080.
The MUX type of the artifact configuration.
Indicates whether the content artifact is enabled or disabled.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
Defines the layout of the video tiles when content sharing is enabled.
Defines the position of the presenter video tile. Default: TopRight.

The attendee IDs of the streams selected for a media pipeline.
The external user IDs of the streams selected for a media pipeline.
The ARN of the sink type.
Destination type to which the media artifacts are saved. You must use an S3 bucket.
ARN of the source from which the media artifacts are captured.
Source type from which the media artifacts are captured. A Chime SDK Meeting is the only supported source.
The MUX type of the video artifact configuration object.
Indicates whether the video artifact is enabled or disabled.
